statements.statement: My government does not want to spend money to help its citizens with cyber related matters
I believe my government wants what is best for me in terms of my cyber well-being
My government is concerned about my cyber welfare and would not knowingly do anything to hurt me
My government only really looks out for themselves
If I were to have cyber-related problems with my devices, my government would want to offer me assistance and support
My government would be capable at making informed cyber related decisions on my behalf
I am uncertain about how capable my government would be at managing my cyber well-being (i.e., online safety and security)
Governments these days have fantastic cyber abilities – they are definitely capable of helping citizens
Government units are always being hacked – not that capable
I feel the current government, all in all, is competent and doing a very good job.
I would trust my government to have my best interests in mind and to secure my devices for me
I am not confident with IT, so cybersecurity is a real challenge
I am not confident with IT so I need more support with my cybersecurity
When an important cyber issue or problem arises, I would feel comfortable depending on my government
Based on my experience with the my government in the past, I know they provide good services.
If I fail to secure my online information and devices, it is no one else’s fault
If I were to experience a cyber-attack I would blame myself
I am not a child – I do not need someone else to help me with my cyber well-being (i.e., online safety and security)
My government wants to place its citizens under surveillance, so why would I let them take responsibility for my cyber well-being (i.e., online safety and security)?
My government tells so many lies that I would not let them onto my devices
Children learn about cybersecurity at school but senior citizens need more government support
Everyone is vulnerable to cyber attacks regardless of age
The underlying technology is insecure – my government needs to hold technology providers accountable
We need to incentivise technology providers to make our devices more secure – they are the ones who can do it
I am not interested in cybersecurity
